page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: They have to go round their stock in the morning and again at night to make sure they are all o.k. In the summer when the cattle and sheep are out on the fields the farmers get to work on cutting their{silage}and{hay}which is stored inside for the Winter. In about September to November the farmers get their{combines}out to cut all the{ {Oats,Barley}nd other crops which they had planted earlier in the year. The seeds are either sprayed with Propcorn and stored or put into a shed with a dryer going which will dry it. The{ {straw}is{baled}and stored with the hay in a dutch barn or shed. In the Winter the cattle come inside for warmth and are fed silage, hay and barley which is bruised. {THE FARMING YEAR IS A VERY BUSY YEAR.}
